sentence: Pim has nearly reached the boiling point; Mrs. van D. is lying in bed with a cold, grumbling; Mr. van D. is growing pale without his cigarettes; Dussel, who’s having to give up many of his comforts, is carping at everyone; etc., etc.
They’ll probably call it “The Musings of an Ugly Duckling.” My diaries certainly won’t be of much use to Mr. Bolkestein or Mr.
My writing’s all mixed up, I’m jumping from one thing to another, and sometimes I seriously doubt whether anyone will ever be interested in this drivel.
All I see around me are dissatisfied and grumpy faces, all I hear are sighs and stifled complaints.
Every day you hear, “If only it were all over!” I really believe, Kit, that I’m a little nutty today, and I don’t know why.
Thanks to our many connections, we’ll soon be able to get these repaired.
You’d think our lives had taken a sudden turn for the worse.
The toilet’s leaking, and the faucet’s stuck.
Here in the Annex no one even bothers to set a good example.
We seem to have run out of luck lately.
We each have to figure out how to get the better of our own moods!
Everyone here is still very tense.
Honestly, things are only as bad as you make them.
